Thanks for your work, @JingsongLi.  

I did some touchups on the test but the rest looked good.
Run Flink RunnableOnService
Run Dataflow RunnableOnService
Merging.

@davorbonaci I also added some doc in the script so people don't depend on the JIRA info. Additionally I rebased it to remove the --client parameter because the documentation of tiered compilation (the links I put before) say that this flag is not needed if tiered compilation is activated and my tests produced similar times.
Feel free to squash everything, I did really tiny commits to make clear each intention. And please tell me if you think something else is missing.

Could you also add a test or check timestamps in one of the existing tests? Not sure how clean it would be since the tests run on 0.9.0.1 as well. Something to look into.

>  As the function is called for every record, it's worth to choose a faster option.
Agreed. Note that this avoids a call to System.getCurrentMillis(), which might be net positive.

More detailed, it's blocked by addRecord(ConsumerRecord<K, V> record) in MockConsumer.

We are not synchronized because these are different subjects, and this PR is not a blocker for that PR, what I am doing for the moment is just looking for Hadoop classes that are needed in more than one project and moving those to hadoop-common.
What I saw in the review is that the reviewers proposed to do this changes (use or enhance hadoop-common) afterwards, to add less noise to the current InputFormat PR.
